author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Update an AWS - EC2 instance with a list of accounts in an AWS organization, which will allow EC2 commands to run in all of them.
automation.name: AwsEC2SyncAccounts

automation.description: Find Security Group rules which allows ::/0 (IPv4) or 0.0.0.0/0.
automation.name: AwsEC2GetPublicSGRules

commands.description: Deregisters the specified AMI.
commands.name: aws-ec2-deregister-image

commands.description: Creates an Amazon EBS-backed AMI from an Amazon EBS-backed instance that is either running or stopped.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-image

commands.description: Describes the specified EBS volumes.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-volumes

commands.description: Modifies the specified attribute of the specified AMI.
commands.name: aws-ec2-modify-image-attribute

commands.description: A waiter function that runs every 15  seconds until a successful state is reached.
commands.name: aws-ec2-waiter-instance-terminated

commands.description: Describes one or more of your EC2 Fleets.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-fleets

commands.description: Starts an Amazon EBS-backed instance that you have previously stopped.
commands.name: aws-ec2-start-instances

commands.description: Detaches an EBS volume from an instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-detach-volume

commands.description: Shuts down one or more instances. This operation is idempotent; if you terminate an instance more than once, each call succeeds.
commands.name: aws-ec2-terminate-instances

commands.description: You can modify several parameters of an existing EBS volume, including volume size, volume type, and IOPS capacity.
commands.name: aws-ec2-modify-volume

commands.description: Creates an entry (a rule) in a network ACL with the specified rule number.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-network-acl-entry

commands.description: Attaches an EBS volume to a running or stopped instance and exposes it to the instance with the specified device name.
commands.name: aws-ec2-attach-volume

commands.description: Deletes the specified EC2 Fleet.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-fleet

commands.description: Describes one or more regions that are currently available to you.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-regions

commands.description: Deletes the specified EBS volume. The volume must be in the available state (not attached to an instance).
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-volume

commands.description: Creates a VPC endpoint.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-vpc-endpoint

commands.description: Releases the specified Elastic IP address.
commands.name: aws-ec2-release-address

commands.description: Describes one or more of your instances.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-instances

commands.description: Creates an EBS volume that can be attached to an instance in the same Availability Zone.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-volume

commands.description: Describes one or more of your VPCs.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-vpcs

commands.description: Describes one or more of your key pairs.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-key-pairs

commands.description: Stops an Amazon EBS-backed instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-stop-instances

commands.description: A waiter function that waits until image is avilable.
commands.name: aws-ec2-waiter-image-available

commands.description: Retrieves the encrypted administrator password for a running Windows instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-get-password-data

commands.description: Launches an EC2 Fleet.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-fleet

commands.description: Enables detailed monitoring for a running instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-monitor-instances

commands.description: Describes one or more of your internet gateways.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-internet-gateway

commands.description: A waiter function that runs every 15  seconds until a successful state is reached.
commands.name: aws-ec2-waiter-instance-running

commands.description: Initiates the copy of an AMI from the specified source region to the current region.
commands.name: aws-ec2-copy-image

commands.description: A waiter function that runs every 15  seconds until a successful state is reached.
commands.name: aws-ec2-waiter-instance-stopped

commands.description: Removes egress rule from a security group. To remove a rule, the values that you specify (for example, ports) must match the existing rule's values exactly.
commands.name: aws-ec2-revoke-security-group-egress-rule

commands.description: Deletes the specified VPC. You must detach or delete all gateways and resources that are associated with the VPC before you can delete it. For example, you must terminate all instances running in the VPC, delete all security groups associated with the VPC (except the default one), delete all route tables associated with the VPC (except the default one), and so on.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-vpc

commands.description: Describes one or more of your security groups.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-security-groups

commands.description: Modifies the specified attribute of the specified instance. You can specify only one attribute at a time. Using this action to change the security groups associated with an elastic network interface (ENI) attached to an instance in a VPC can result in an error if the instance has more than one ENI. To change the security groups associated with an ENI attached to an instance that has multiple ENIs, we recommend that you use the ModifyNetworkInterfaceAttribute action.
commands.name: aws-ec2-modify-instance-attribute

commands.description: Deletes a security group.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-security-group

commands.description: Release on demand dedicated host.
commands.name: aws-ec2-release-hosts

commands.description: Creates a Traffic Mirror session.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-traffic-mirror-session

commands.description: Allocates a Dedicated Host to your account.
commands.name: aws-ec2-allocate-hosts

commands.description: Associates an Elastic IP address with an instance or a network interface.
commands.name: aws-ec2-associate-address

commands.description: Requests a reboot of one or more instances. This operation is asynchronous; it only queues a request to reboot the specified instances. The operation succeeds if the instances are valid and belong to you. Requests to reboot terminated instances are ignored. If an instance does not cleanly shut down within four minutes, Amazon EC2 performs a hard reboot.
commands.name: aws-ec2-reboot-instances

commands.description: Removes egress rule from a security group. To remove a rule, the values that you specify (for example, ports) must match the existing rule's values exactly.
commands.name: aws-ec2-revoke-security-group-ingress-rule

commands.description: Describes one or more of your subnets.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-subnets

commands.description: Adds ingress rule to a security group.
commands.name: aws-ec2-authorize-security-group-ingress-rule

commands.description: Deletes the specified subnet. You must terminate all running instances in the subnet before you can delete the subnet.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-subnet

commands.description: Describes the running instances for the specified EC2 Fleet.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-fleet-instances

commands.description: Creates a launch template. A launch template contains the parameters to launch an instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-launch-template

commands.description: Disables detailed monitoring for a running instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-unmonitor-instances

commands.description: Creates a network ACL in a VPC. Network ACLs provide an optional layer of security (in addition to security groups) for the instances in your VPC.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-network-acl

commands.description: Gets the public IP addresses that have been discovered by IPAM.
commands.name: aws-ec2-get-ipam-discovered-public-addresses

commands.description: Describes one or more launch templates.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-launch-templates

commands.description: Describes one or more of the EBS snapshots available to you.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-snapshots

commands.description: Get The latest AMI.
commands.name: aws-ec2-get-latest-ami

commands.description: Describes resource discovery association with an Amazon VPC IPAM. An associated resource discovery is a resource discovery that has been associated with an IPAM.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-ipam-resource-discovery-associations

commands.description: Describes one or more of your Elastic IP addresses.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-addresses

commands.description: Adds or overwrites one or more tags for the specified Amazon EC2 resource or resources.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-tags

commands.description: Modifies the specified EC2 Fleet.
commands.name: aws-ec2-modify-fleet

commands.description: Describes your IAM instance profile associations.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-iam-instance-profile-associations

commands.description: Deletes a launch template. Deleting a launch template deletes all of its versions.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-launch-template

commands.description: Deletes the specified snapshot.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-snapshot

commands.description: Launches the specified number of instances using an AMI for which you have permissions. You can create a launch template , which is a resource that contains the parameters to launch an instance. When you launch an instance using RunInstances , you can specify the launch template instead of specifying the launch parameters. An instance is ready for you to use when its in the running state. You can check the state of your instance using DescribeInstances.
commands.name: aws-ec2-run-instances

commands.description: Allocates an Elastic IP address.
commands.name: aws-ec2-allocate-address

commands.description: Copies a point-in-time snapshot of an EBS volume and stores it in Amazon S3. You can copy the snapshot within the same region or from one region to another.
commands.name: aws-ec2-copy-snapshot

commands.description: Creates a snapshot of an EBS volume and stores it in Amazon S3. You can use snapshots for backups, to make copies of EBS volumes, and to save data before shutting down an instance.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-snapshot

commands.description: A waiter function that runs every 15  seconds until a successful state is reached.
commands.name: aws-ec2-waiter-instance-status-ok

commands.description: Deletes the specified internet gateway. You must detach the internet gateway from the VPC before you can delete it.
commands.name: aws-ec2-delete-internet-gateway

commands.description: Adds egress rule to a security group.
commands.name: aws-ec2-authorize-security-group-egress-rule

commands.description: Creates a security group.
commands.name: aws-ec2-create-security-group

commands.description: Describes one or more of the images (AMIs, AKIs, and ARIs) available to you. Images available to you include public images, private images that you own, and private images owned by other AWS accounts but for which you have explicit launch permissions.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-images

commands.description: Modifies the specified network interface attribute. You can specify only one attribute at a time.
commands.name: aws-ec2-modify-network-interface-attribute

commands.description: A waiter function that waits until the snapshot is complate.
commands.name: aws-ec2-waiter-snapshot_completed

commands.description: Adds or removes permission settings for the specified snapshot.
commands.name: aws-ec2-modify-snapshot-permission

commands.description: Detaches an internet gateway from a VPC, disabling connectivity between the internet and the VPC. The VPC must not contain any running instances with Elastic IP addresses or public IPv4 addresses.
commands.name: aws-ec2-detach-internet-gateway

commands.description: Disassociates an Elastic IP address from the instance or network interface its associated with.
commands.name: aws-ec2-disassociate-address

commands.description: Describes one or more of the Reserved Instances that you purchased.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-reserved-instances

commands.description: Describes IPAM resource discoveries. A resource discovery is an IPAM component that enables IPAM to manage and monitor resources that belong to the owning account.
commands.name: aws-ec2-describe-ipam-resource-discoveries

integration.description: Amazon Web Services Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2).
integration.name: AWS - EC2

playbook.description: Sync a list of IP addresses to an AWS Security Group.
playbook.name: IP Whitelist - AWS Security Group

description: Amazon Web Services Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)
name: AWS - EC2
readme:
The AWS content enables you to integrate with AWS EC2. AWS EC2 is a web service from which you rent virtual computers on which to run your own computer applications. This integration enables you to access information about your AWS EC2 virtual servers and create new AWS EC2 virtual servers. You can launch virtual servers, configure security and networking, and manage storage.

## What does this pack do
This integration enables you to:
- Obtain descriptions about your AWS EC2 instances, images, regions, addresses, snapshots, etc.
- Allocate an elastic IP address and associate it with an instance or a network interface.
- Create a snapshot of an EBS volume and stores it in Amazon S3
- Create an Amazon EBS-backed AMI from an Amazon EBS-backed instance that is either running or stopped.
- Modify several parameters of an existing EBS volume
- Add or overwrite one or more tags for the specified Amazon EC2 resource or resources.
- Start, stop, or terminate an Amazon EBS-backed instance.
- Create, attach, or detach an EBS volume.
- Create or delete a security group.
- Monitor your instances.
